jobTitle: Aviation Depot Maintenance and Repair Engineer/Scientist
jobDescription: Description Huntington Ingalls Industries - Technical Solutions Division, Integrated Mission Solutions Group (Camber Corporation) provides mission-critical engineering and technical service to Information Technology, Federal Civilian, and National Security, Aerospace & Defense and International government and commercial customers at over 100 locations worldwide.  HII-TSD, Integrated Mission Solutions Group (Camber Corporation) is currently seeking an Engineer/Scientist to work out of their Corpus Christi office. Duties and Responsibilities(to include but not be limited to the following):Support government engineers with expert advice, analysis, research and technical guidance.Develops technical concepts, plans for implementation, monitors technical progress, designs tests, assesses performance data, and develops solutions to technical problems.Authors, edits, contributes to production of technical reports and other technical products, such as overall project concepts and descriptions, test plans, and technical reports.Maintain knowledge of relevant scientific principles, application methods/procedures, and integration of same into engineering projects using systems, software, electrical, mechanical or civil engineering practices.Qualifications and Experience:Required-Bachelor of Science degree, preferably in Aerospace, Mechanical or Electrical engineering.Seven to ten years of engineering experience.Knowledge and experience reading and interpreting engineering drawings, depot repair manuals, and technical data for repair development and design.Component level engineering/maintenance experienceDemonstrate an ability to work independently; able to understand, anticipate, and act on the requirements of senior leaders.Strong oral communication and listening skills.Strong ability to write detailed technical substantiation analysis, reports, and briefings.Competence in MS Office and related computer skills.Preferred-Current Active DoD Security ClearanceDepot level maintenance engineering experience in support of Army rotary aircraft.Security:Must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Security Clearance.All candidates will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation and drug screening per HII requirements.About Us Camber Corporation is part of the Integrated Mission Solutions Group of HII’s Technical Solutions division. Integrated Mission Solutions Group is a leading provider of Agile Software Engineering and Information Technology solutions; All Hazards services; Modeling, Simulation, and Training solutions and services; Unmanned Systems support; Intelligence Analysis and Operations; and Engineering and Management services to Department of Defense, Federal, and commercial customers.  Integrated Mission Solutions Group (Camber), a subsidiary of Huntington Ingalls Industries, Inc. (HII) is headquartered in Huntsville, AL. From Camber’s founding in 1990, we have grown to 32 offices, positioned to provide responsive support to our customers across the United States. We deploy personnel to support our customers globally, including many locations in Asia, Africa, and Europe, providing daily interface on technical, programmatic, and operations issues. Overall, more than 1,600 Camber professionals deliver ISO 9001:2008-certified and CMMI ML3 high-value solutions to customers worldwide.
